section.name: SOC OF CULTURE: Class Culture & Historical Change

comments:
This class examines the ideas of social classes as well as status groups in everyday life. Goffmanian and other theories of interactions applications are also examined in this course. Topics like stratification in patrimonial and aristocratic societies as well as the effects of democratization are also investigated.
The majority of the students in this class felt that the material covered was very “interesting.” Overall, the students felt that the content was very “fascinating.”
The students generally had a very positive review of Professor Collins’ teaching style.  They applauded his “clever teaching methods” and the interaction that occurred. However, some had hoped that there was more time for “in class discussion.”  Additionally, a few students were disappointed that the “course readings were barely addressed in class.” 
The majority of the students in the class were upperclassman but this class would be suited for anyone interested in sociology.  It is suitable for both major and non-major students.
